revised_title: Photon Antibunching in Single Atom Fluorescence: A Dressed Atom Approach
tldr: The authors explore the phenomenon of photon antibunching in single atom fluorescence using a dressed atom approach. They explain how the interaction between atoms and laser photons creates dressed atom energy levels, which can be used to interpret fluorescence and absorption spectra. The authors also discuss how photon correlation signals can be modulated by the coherence between atomic sublevels, similar to quantum beat experiments. This research has implications for understanding radiative cascades and the behavior of atoms in strong light fields.
